>>>>>> Hi,
>>>>>> Simon pisze:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> What is the difference using this product over the built in  
>>>>>>> Terminal
>>>>>>> Services functions in Windows?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> 1. Special extentions for xHarbour users allow the application  
>>>>>> to be
>>>>>> aware about the remote mode of execution and use Terminal RPC  
>>>>>> (remote
>>>>>> procedure call) to easily call xHarbour code attached to gte.exe
>>>>>> (terminal client being executed on the client machine). This  
>>>>>> allows
>>>>>> (where appropriate) to split the application functionality  
>>>>>> between
>>>>>> server and client.
>>>>>> 2. In a few months we will release Linux client which is not  
>>>>>> natively
>>>>>> available for Terminal services.
>>>>>> 3. Ability to set up multi-user servers on Vista and XP (not on  
>>>>>> the
>>>>>> server systems only)
>>>>>> 4. Product remotes application windows only (not the entire  
>>>>>> desktop)
>>>>>> which is not available on some Terminal services versions
>>>>>> 5. It is cheaper. To legally use TS on Vista or Win2008 you  
>>>>>> need to
>>>>>> purchase both TS license and TS CAL license.
>>>>>> Regards,
>>>>>> Jacek

From jarabal at gmail.com  Tue Jun 30 12:22:48 2009
From: jarabal at gmail.com (Xavi)
Date: Tue Jun 30 12:23:08 2009
Subject: [Harbour] SF.net SVN: harbour-project:[11574] trunk/harbour
In-Reply-To: <20090630134951.GA10715@uran.home.aster.pl>
References: <E1MLbZQ-0006Qk-Qa@74yxhf1.ch3.sourceforge.com>	<4A49FCFD.2030901@gmail.com>
	<20090630134951.GA10715@uran.home.aster.pl>
Message-ID: <4A4A3BD8.705@gmail.com>

hb_par[v]dsbuff() return same buffer pased, szDate, but hb_par[v]ds() I think that logic is similar to hb_parc[x] although both
return a writable area (asString.value, hb_stack.szDate), IMHO.

../../dlmalloc.c:4065: warning: dereferencing pointer 'b' does break strict-aliasing rules
Another thing, I do not know how to clean warnings in dlmalloc.c when compiling with g++ and strict-aliasing. 	
I think the code is correct and it's a problem with the name of tags and/or the interpretation of g++ rules in macros with
(char*) but g++ option -fno-strict-aliasing or #pragma GCC diagnostic warning "-w", that's only work, affects the rest of code.
Any idea?

--
Xavi


Przemyslaw Czerpak escribi?:
> On Tue, 30 Jun 2009, Xavi wrote:
>> Some questions reviewing hbapi.h
>> Should be hb_pards and hb_parvds const?	
> 
> buffer returned by hb_par[v]ds() is writable so we can leave it
> as is. Anyhow if you think that it will be cleaner to define
> this buffer as readonly then we can change it.
> 
>> Do you need to change hbtypes.h?
> 
> Yes, they should be updated though I do not know if it's worth to keep
> all these function wrappers. For .prg code compiled with -gc2 we need
> only hb_vmExecute() and hb_vmProcessSymbols().
> For -gc3 we need also hb_xvm*() functions which are still missing.
> All other function wrappers cover only small part of public
> Harbour API so they are usable only in some limited way for 3-rd
> party C code which does not use any other functions.
> 
> best regards,
> Przemek
> _______________________________________________
> Harbour mailing list
> Harbour@harbour-project.org
> http://lists.harbour-project.org/mailman/listinfo/harbour
>

But this is that happened to me

I am working until two days ago using Kubuntu 8.04

this distro includes QT 4.3.2  and  trying to compile HArbour in linux
recentrly appears the problem that not compile anymore, beacuse
an errors appears : Only Compile using 4.5.0  etc etc etc

I try to update from hand , and I did it but , I Broke packages dependencies
in Linux

Kubuntu 8.04 do not have QT actualization beyond this version ( 4.3.2 )

Well , I don't like the NEW KDE 4 desktop and only two days ago I get
a Kubuntu 9.04 Version with KDE 3.5 desktop.

This distro , the most updated today of UBUNTU , includes QT 4.5.0
and not exists ( or at least I didn't found It) other  in UBUNTU
repositories.

I hope you understand my comment and don't be angry for It.

Regards
Bruno

Hi Bruno,

I'm exactly sure what is the point of your discussion,
but in Harbour our goal is to support QT 4.5.0 and upper
versions.

Older version may or may not work, for our project this
is not a goal or priority.

4.5.0 is the first version which can be used with
commercial apps for free. That's the reason.

Brgds,
Viktor

Okay, in this case of course we should fix our code to
only use those calls if detected version supports it. We
use such method in all other contribs where there is
an external dependency (hbodbc, hbsqlit3, hbcurl f.e.).

Do you have any specific bugs to report here regarding QT?

Compilation errors, unresolved externals?

Brgds,
Viktor

LINK : fatal error LNK1104: can not open the file 'LIBC.lib'

compilation of the harbour of SVN?

My environment variables, are thus:
set HB_COMPILER=msvc
set HB_INSTALL_PREFIX=d:\devel\hb-%HB_COMPILER%
set HB_BUILD_IMPLIB=yes
set HB_INC_PGSQL=d:\pgsql\include
set HB_DIR_PGSQL=d:\pgsql
set HB_DIR_BLAT=D:\devel\blat262
set HB_DIR_ADS=D:\devel\ads
set HB_INC_GD=D:\devel\gd-2.0.34\include
set HB_DIR_GD=D:\devel\gd-2.0.34
